DOCNAME: CASE OF ESAT BAYRAM v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 2;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant ’s brother PERSON , who was a NORP citizen of NORP origin , was called up for military service in DATE . He was DATE at the time .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE PERSON started his initial two months’ training in GPE . On DATE he was granted leave for DATE . On his return , he was informed that he had been appointed to GPE . On DATE PERSON went to GPE to join his unit . His superior was Mr ORG .
CARDINAL . DATE the applicant received a telephone call from his brother , who stated that he was being bullied by his superior . He told the applicant that he had been threatened with death by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s brother was posted to sentry duty . At TIME he was seriously wounded by CARDINAL bullet and he was immediately taken to ORG , where he was operated upon . At TIME DATE , ORG called the applicant and informed him that there had been an accident and his brother had shot himself . The applicant went to GPE immediately . ORG and another soldier took the applicant to hospital . His brother was in the intensive care unit , unconscious . When the applicant asked ORG how the incident had happened , he told the applicant that he had been QUANTITY away from PERSON when he saw him point the gun towards himself and fire . He explained that PERSON had been taken immediately to the hospital where he had been operated upon .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant was able to speak to his brother briefly at the hospital . PERSON allegedly told the applicant :
“ I saw ORG approaching and I remembered his death threats . I thought he was going to shoot me . I do not remember what happened but I am sure that I did not shoot myself . ”
CARDINAL . The applicant ’s brother told him that he wanted to be transferred to GPE . He also said that he had written a letter and given it to his friend PERSON PERSON , also a conscript .
CARDINAL . NORP In the meantime , statements were taken from witnesses to the event , namely from Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON .

CARDINAL . In his statement PERSON said that after lunch , as he was walking around , he heard a single gun shot . When he went to see what had happened , he saw PERSON lying on the ground , heavily injured . He was mumbling , saying “ you have burnt me PERSON , I am burning , I am in pain ” . PERSON said PERSON rifle was between his knees .

CARDINAL . Mr PERSON said that when he heard the shot , he immediately went to the scene of incident . PERSON was lying on the ground . He was alive but heavily bleeding . His rifle was between his legs .

CARDINAL . In his statement , PERSON maintained that PERSON had told him that he would commit suicide as the girl whom he was in love with was getting married to someone else . He also said that PERSON had given him a letter to be sent to his parents , should anything happen to him .

CARDINAL . DATE , the applicant also spoke to Mr PERSON , who allegedly told him that PERSON had been pressurised by his superior ORG . He told the applicant that the soldiers had been forced not to speak to PERSON and added that PERSON had no bed and was sleeping on the floor . Mr PERSON confirmed that PERSON had given him a letter ; however he explained that somebody had taken it from his bag .
CARDINAL . The applicant wanted to transfer his brother to another hospital but the doctors refused . The applicant returned to GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s brother developed disseminated intravascular coagulation and the doctors decided to transfer him to ORG in GPE . He died from internal bleeding in the ambulance during the transfer .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an application with ORG office to clarify the circumstances in which his brother had died . He stated that he doubted that his brother had shot himself and requested an autopsy .
CARDINAL . The body examination report , dated DATE , stated the following :

“ A surgical incision measuring QUANTITY begins from the area between the nipples and extends centrally to below the navel . Several old razor wound scars are noted between the left and right shoulders and elbows , measuring QUANTITY each . The name PERSON is carved with a razor or another sharp object on the outer side of the left arm . A bullet exit hole on the left lumbar region measuring QUANTITY is noted . A bullet entry hole was observed in the stitched wound in the chest area ”
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant was also present during this body examination . He stated that he had doubts about his brother ’s death and requested a second autopsy .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG conducted an examination of the scene of incident .

CARDINAL . On DATE the military investigation board started an investigation into PERSON death . On DATE the board took a statement from ORG . PERSON explained that when he heard that the applicant ’s brother had shot himself , he immediately went to see what had happened and called an ambulance . He saw that there was blood on PERSON abdomen .
CARDINAL . On DATE the military investigation board delivered its report and concluded that no fault could be attributed to Mr ORG or the hospital .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on CARDINAL DATE a second autopsy was conducted on PERSON ’s body by ORG of ORG . The report stated that no bullet was found in the body and that the detailed report would be delivered at DATE . Samples of the wound from the xiphoid process and back were sent for further chemical examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered its report concerning the chemical examination of these CARDINAL pieces of skin . Large amounts of nitrite - nitrate ions were observed on the piece of skin taken from PERSON ’s back and none was found on the piece of skin taken from the xiphoid process .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered a non - jurisdiction decision and transferred the file to the Gölcük Military Prosecutor .

CARDINAL . Upon the request of ORG , on CARDINAL DATE an expert examination was conducted on the hive obtained from the scene of the incident . While conducting the examination , the expert fired CARDINAL further shots using the rifle that had been used by PERSON . On CARDINAL DATE the CARDINAL spent cartridge cases , namely the CARDINAL found following the incident and the CARDINAL obtained by the expert , were examined at ORG and it was concluded that they all came from the same rifle .

CARDINAL . On DATE Miss PERSON gave a statement to the gendarmes . When asked about PERSON suicide , Miss PERSON said that she had been friends with PERSON for DATE . She explained that they loved each other and denied that she was engaged to somebody else .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant gave a statement to ORG . He explained that his brother PERSON had been threatened with death by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered its medical report . Making reference to its previous examinations dated CARDINAL and DATE , it concluded that PERSON had been shot in the back . According to the report , a bullet had entered his back and exited from the right below the xiphoid process . In order to establish the exact range from which the shot was fired , a further chemical examination of PERSON GPE ’s clothes was requested .

CARDINAL . In a report dated DATE the physical ballistics expertise branch stated that no traces of gunfire were found on either the shirt or the vest of PERSON . The reports further concluded that there was a hole in the back part of the shirt , measuring QUANTITY .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG delivered its final report . In its detailed report , it made reference to all of the previous forensic examinations . It stated that although when bullet entry and exit holes are examined , it is usually the small holes that are ascertained to be entry holes and large holes to be exit holes , it was medically possible for the opposite to be found as well . The report concluded that although the autopsy report dated DATE had stated that the entrance hole had been in the back , as following the chemical examination no nitrite and nitrate ions had been found on PERSON clothes , this should indicate that the bullet must have entered from the xiphoid process . In the report , it was further stated that there was no indication to determine whether the shot had been fired from close range or point blank range . It continued :

“ We unanimously agree that the bullet had entered the body from the lower left part of the xiphoid process , passing through the muscle under the skin into the abdominal cavity , passing slightly to the left , leaving the body from the upper part of the lumber region ; and that because persons move , the route of the bullet through the body can not assist in medically determining the direction from which the bullet had been fired or the height above the ground ”
As a result , in the report , it was unanimously accepted that the bullet had entered from the abdomen .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided not to prosecute . The applicant appealed against that decision . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal and this was notified to the applicant on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant obtained a medical report from Mr PERSON , a professor of ORG to ORG . After making an analysis of the available documentary evidence , PERSON concluded that the presence of a small circular gunshot wound in the back and a larger gunshot wound in the front of the abdomen was suggestive of the entrance wound being in the back . The presence of nitrate - nitrite ions on the skin taken from the back of the body and their absence on the front would provide confirmatory evidence that the back contained the entrance wound . However , it was also stated that these findings were inconsistent with the fact that no gunshot residue was identified anywhere on the clothing . In sum , Professor PERSON concluded that the evidence supported the theory that the entrance wound was in the back .
